class.name: String
class.description: This is the built-in string class (and the one used by GDScript). It supports Unicode and provides all necessary means for string handling. Strings are reference-counted and use a copy-on-write approach, so passing them around is cheap in resources.

constructor.name: String
constructor.description: Constructs a [String] as a copy of the given [String].

constructor.name: String
constructor.description: Constructs a new String from the given [NodePath].

constructor.name: String
constructor.description: Constructs a new String from the given [StringName].

method.name: begins_with
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the string begins with the given string.

method.name: bigrams
method.description: Returns the bigrams (pairs of consecutive letters) of this string.

method.name: bin_to_int
method.description: Converts a string containing a binary number into an integer. Binary strings can either be prefixed with [code]0b[/code] or not, and they can also start with a [code]-[/code] before the optional prefix. [codeblocks] [gdscript] print("0b101".bin_to_int()) # Prints "5". print("101".bin_to_int()) # Prints "5". [/gdscript] [csharp] GD.Print("0b101".BinToInt()); // Prints "5". GD.Print("101".BinToInt()); // Prints "5". [/csharp] [/codeblocks]

method.name: c_escape
method.description: Returns a copy of the string with special characters escaped using the C language standard.

method.name: c_unescape
method.description: Returns a copy of the string with escaped characters replaced by their meanings. Supported escape sequences are [code]\'[/code], [code]\"[/code], [code]\?[/code], [code]\\[/code], [code]\a[/code], [code]\b[/code], [code]\f[/code], [code]\n[/code], [code]\r[/code], [code]\t[/code], [code]\v[/code]. [b]Note:[/b] Unlike the GDScript parser, this method doesn't support the [code]\uXXXX[/code] escape sequence.

method.name: capitalize
method.description: Changes the case of some letters. Replaces underscores with spaces, adds spaces before in-word uppercase characters, converts all letters to lowercase, then capitalizes the first letter and every letter following a space character. For [code]capitalize camelCase mixed_with_underscores[/code], it will return [code]Capitalize Camel Case Mixed With Underscores[/code].

method.name: casecmp_to
method.description: Performs a case-sensitive comparison to another string. Returns [code]-1[/code] if less than, [code]1[/code] if greater than, or [code]0[/code] if equal. "less than" or "greater than" are determined by the [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Unicode_characters]Unicode code points[/url] of each string, which roughly matches the alphabetical order. [b]Behavior with different string lengths:[/b] Returns [code]1[/code] if the "base" string is longer than the [code]to[/code] string or [code]-1[/code] if the "base" string is shorter than the [code]to[/code] string. Keep in mind this length is determined by the number of Unicode codepoints, [i]not[/i] the actual visible characters. [b]Behavior with empty strings:[/b] Returns [code]-1[/code] if the "base" string is empty, [code]1[/code] if the [code]to[/code] string is empty or [code]0[/code] if both strings are empty. To get a boolean result from a string comparison, use the [code]==[/code] operator instead. See also [method nocasecmp_to] and [method naturalnocasecmp_to].

method.name: count
method.description: Returns the number of occurrences of substring [code]what[/code] between [code]from[/code] and [code]to[/code] positions. If [code]from[/code] and [code]to[/code] equals 0 the whole string will be used. If only [code]to[/code] equals 0 the remained substring will be used.

method.name: countn
method.description: Returns the number of occurrences of substring [code]what[/code] (ignoring case) between [code]from[/code] and [code]to[/code] positions. If [code]from[/code] and [code]to[/code] equals 0 the whole string will be used. If only [code]to[/code] equals 0 the remained substring will be used.

method.name: dedent
method.description: Returns a copy of the string with indentation (leading tabs and spaces) removed. See also [method indent] to add indentation.

method.name: ends_with
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the string ends with the given string.

method.name: find
method.description: Returns the index of the [b]first[/b] case-sensitive occurrence of the specified string in this instance, or [code]-1[/code]. Optionally, the starting search index can be specified, continuing to the end of the string. [b]Note:[/b] If you just want to know whether a string contains a substring, use the [code]in[/code] operator as follows: [codeblocks] [gdscript] print("i" in "team") # Will print `false`. [/gdscript] [csharp] // C# has no in operator, but we can use `Contains()`. GD.Print("team".Contains("i")); // Will print `false`. [/csharp] [/codeblocks]

method.name: findn
method.description: Returns the index of the [b]first[/b] case-insensitive occurrence of the specified string in this instance, or [code]-1[/code]. Optionally, the starting search index can be specified, continuing to the end of the string.

method.name: format
method.description: Formats the string by replacing all occurrences of [code]placeholder[/code] with [code]values[/code].

method.name: get_base_dir
method.description: If the string is a valid file path, returns the base directory name.

method.name: get_basename
method.description: If the string is a valid file path, returns the full file path without the extension.

method.name: get_extension
method.description: Returns the extension without the leading period character ([code].[/code]) if the string is a valid file name or path. If the string does not contain an extension, returns an empty string instead. [codeblock] print("/path/to/file.txt".get_extension()) # "txt" print("file.txt".get_extension()) # "txt" print("file.sample.txt".get_extension()) # "txt" print(".txt".get_extension()) # "txt" print("file.txt.".get_extension()) # "" (empty string) print("file.txt..".get_extension()) # "" (empty string) print("txt".get_extension()) # "" (empty string) print("".get_extension()) # "" (empty string) [/codeblock]

method.name: get_file
method.description: If the string is a valid file path, returns the filename.

method.name: get_slice
method.description: Splits a string using a [code]delimiter[/code] and returns a substring at index [code]slice[/code]. Returns an empty string if the index doesn't exist. This is a more performant alternative to [method split] for cases when you need only one element from the array at a fixed index. Example: [codeblock] print("i/am/example/string".get_slice("/", 2)) # Prints 'example'. [/codeblock]

method.name: hash
method.description: Hashes the string and returns a 32-bit integer.

method.name: hex_to_int
method.description: Converts a string containing a hexadecimal number into an integer. Hexadecimal strings can either be prefixed with [code]0x[/code] or not, and they can also start with a [code]-[/code] before the optional prefix. [codeblocks] [gdscript] print("0xff".hex_to_int()) # Prints "255". print("ab".hex_to_int()) # Prints "171". [/gdscript] [csharp] GD.Print("0xff".HexToInt()); // Prints "255". GD.Print("ab".HexToInt()); // Prints "171". [/csharp] [/codeblocks]

method.name: indent
method.description: Returns a copy of the string with lines indented with [code]prefix[/code]. For example, the string can be indented with two tabs using [code]"\t\t"[/code], or four spaces using [code]" "[/code]. The prefix can be any string so it can also be used to comment out strings with e.g. [code]"# "[/code]. See also [method dedent] to remove indentation. [b]Note:[/b] Empty lines are kept empty.

method.name: insert
method.description: Returns a copy of the string with the substring [code]what[/code] inserted at the given position.

method.name: is_absolute_path
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the string is a path to a file or directory and its starting point is explicitly defined. This includes [code]res://[/code], [code]user://[/code], [code]C:\[/code], [code]/[/code], etc.

method.name: is_empty
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the length of the string equals [code]0[/code].

method.name: is_relative_path
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the string is a path to a file or directory and its starting point is implicitly defined within the context it is being used. The starting point may refer to the current directory ([code]./[/code]), or the current [Node].

method.name: is_subsequence_of
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this string is a subsequence of the given string.

method.name: is_subsequence_ofi
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this string is a subsequence of the given string, without considering case.

method.name: is_valid_filename
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this string is free from characters that aren't allowed in file names, those being: [code]: / \ ? * " | % < >[/code]

method.name: is_valid_float
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this string contains a valid float.

method.name: is_valid_hex_number
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this string contains a valid hexadecimal number. If [code]with_prefix[/code] is [code]true[/code], then a validity of the hexadecimal number is determined by [code]0x[/code] prefix, for instance: [code]0xDEADC0DE[/code].

method.name: is_valid_html_color
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this string contains a valid color in hexadecimal HTML notation. Other HTML notations such as named colors or [code]hsl()[/code] colors aren't considered valid by this method and will return [code]false[/code].

method.name: is_valid_identifier
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this string is a valid identifier. A valid identifier may contain only letters, digits and underscores ([code]_[/code]) and the first character may not be a digit.

method.name: is_valid_int
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this string contains a valid integer.

method.name: is_valid_ip_address
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this string contains only a well-formatted IPv4 or IPv6 address. This method considers [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reserved_IP_addresses]reserved IP addresses[/url] such as [code]0.0.0.0[/code] as valid.

method.name: join
method.description: Return a [String] which is the concatenation of the [code]parts[/code]. The separator between elements is the string providing this method. Example: [codeblocks] [gdscript] print(", ".join(["One", "Two", "Three", "Four"])) [/gdscript] [csharp] GD.Print(String.Join(",", new string[] {"One", "Two", "Three", "Four"})); [/csharp] [/codeblocks]

method.name: json_escape
method.description: Returns a copy of the string with special characters escaped using the JSON standard.

method.name: left
method.description: Returns a number of characters from the left of the string. If negative [code]position[/code] is used, the characters are counted downwards from [String]'s length. Examples: [codeblock] print("sample text".left(3)) #prints "sam" print("sample text".left(-3)) #prints "sample t" [/codeblock]

method.name: length
method.description: Returns the string's amount of characters.

method.name: lpad
method.description: Formats a string to be at least [code]min_length[/code] long by adding [code]character[/code]s to the left of the string.

method.name: lstrip
method.description: Returns a copy of the string with characters removed from the left. The [code]chars[/code] argument is a string specifying the set of characters to be removed. [b]Note:[/b] The [code]chars[/code] is not a prefix. See [method trim_prefix] method that will remove a single prefix string rather than a set of characters.

method.name: match
method.description: Does a simple case-sensitive expression match, where [code]"*"[/code] matches zero or more arbitrary characters and [code]"?"[/code] matches any single character except a period ([code]"."[/code]).

method.name: matchn
method.description: Does a simple case-insensitive expression match, where [code]"*"[/code] matches zero or more arbitrary characters and [code]"?"[/code] matches any single character except a period ([code]"."[/code]).

method.name: md5_buffer
method.description: Returns the MD5 hash of the string as an array of bytes.

method.name: md5_text
method.description: Returns the MD5 hash of the string as a string.

method.name: naturalnocasecmp_to
method.description: Performs a case-insensitive [i]natural order[/i] comparison to another string. Returns [code]-1[/code] if less than, [code]1[/code] if greater than, or [code]0[/code] if equal. "less than" or "greater than" are determined by the [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Unicode_characters]Unicode code points[/url] of each string, which roughly matches the alphabetical order. Internally, lowercase characters will be converted to uppercase during the comparison. When used for sorting, natural order comparison will order suites of numbers as expected by most people. If you sort the numbers from 1 to 10 using natural order, you will get [code][1, 2, 3, ...][/code] instead of [code][1, 10, 2, 3, ...][/code]. [b]Behavior with different string lengths:[/b] Returns [code]1[/code] if the "base" string is longer than the [code]to[/code] string or [code]-1[/code] if the "base" string is shorter than the [code]to[/code] string. Keep in mind this length is determined by the number of Unicode codepoints, [i]not[/i] the actual visible characters. [b]Behavior with empty strings:[/b] Returns [code]-1[/code] if the "base" string is empty, [code]1[/code] if the [code]to[/code] string is empty or [code]0[/code] if both strings are empty. To get a boolean result from a string comparison, use the [code]==[/code] operator instead. See also [method nocasecmp_to] and [method casecmp_to].

method.name: nocasecmp_to
method.description: Performs a case-insensitive comparison to another string. Returns [code]-1[/code] if less than, [code]1[/code] if greater than, or [code]0[/code] if equal. "less than" or "greater than" are determined by the [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Unicode_characters]Unicode code points[/url] of each string, which roughly matches the alphabetical order. Internally, lowercase characters will be converted to uppercase during the comparison. [b]Behavior with different string lengths:[/b] Returns [code]1[/code] if the "base" string is longer than the [code]to[/code] string or [code]-1[/code] if the "base" string is shorter than the [code]to[/code] string. Keep in mind this length is determined by the number of Unicode codepoints, [i]not[/i] the actual visible characters. [b]Behavior with empty strings:[/b] Returns [code]-1[/code] if the "base" string is empty, [code]1[/code] if the [code]to[/code] string is empty or [code]0[/code] if both strings are empty. To get a boolean result from a string comparison, use the [code]==[/code] operator instead. See also [method casecmp_to] and [method naturalnocasecmp_to].

method.name: num
method.description: Converts a [float] to a string representation of a decimal number. The number of decimal places can be specified with [code]decimals[/code]. If [code]decimals[/code] is [code]-1[/code] (default), decimal places will be automatically adjusted so that the string representation has 14 significant digits (counting both digits to the left and the right of the decimal point). Trailing zeros are not included in the string. The last digit will be rounded and not truncated. Some examples: [codeblock] String.num(3.141593) # "3.141593" String.num(3.141593, 3) # "3.142" String.num(3.14159300) # "3.141593", no trailing zeros. # Last digit will be rounded up here, which reduces total digit count since # trailing zeros are removed: String.num(42.129999, 5) # "42.13" # If `decimals` is not specified, the total amount of significant digits is 14: String.num(-0.0000012345432123454321) # "-0.00000123454321" String.num(-10000.0000012345432123454321) # "-10000.0000012345" [/codeblock]

method.name: pad_decimals
method.description: Formats a number to have an exact number of [code]digits[/code] after the decimal point.

method.name: pad_zeros
method.description: Formats a number to have an exact number of [code]digits[/code] before the decimal point.

method.name: plus_file
method.description: If the string is a path, this concatenates [code]file[/code] at the end of the string as a subpath. E.g. [code]"this/is".plus_file("path") == "this/is/path"[/code].

method.name: repeat
method.description: Returns original string repeated a number of times. The number of repetitions is given by the argument.

method.name: replace
method.description: Replaces occurrences of a case-sensitive substring with the given one inside the string.

method.name: replacen
method.description: Replaces occurrences of a case-insensitive substring with the given one inside the string.

method.name: rfind
method.description: Returns the index of the [b]last[/b] case-sensitive occurrence of the specified string in this instance, or [code]-1[/code]. Optionally, the starting search index can be specified, continuing to the beginning of the string.

method.name: rfindn
method.description: Returns the index of the [b]last[/b] case-insensitive occurrence of the specified string in this instance, or [code]-1[/code]. Optionally, the starting search index can be specified, continuing to the beginning of the string.

method.name: right
method.description: Returns a number of characters from the right of the string. If negative [code]position[/code] is used, the characters are counted downwards from [String]'s length. Examples: [codeblock] print("sample text".right(3)) #prints "ext" print("sample text".right(-3)) #prints "ple text" [/codeblock]

method.name: rpad
method.description: Formats a string to be at least [code]min_length[/code] long by adding [code]character[/code]s to the right of the string.

method.name: rsplit
method.description: Splits the string by a [code]delimiter[/code] string and returns an array of the substrings, starting from right. The splits in the returned array are sorted in the same order as the original string, from left to right. If [code]maxsplit[/code] is specified, it defines the number of splits to do from the right up to [code]maxsplit[/code]. The default value of 0 means that all items are split, thus giving the same result as [method split]. Example: [codeblocks] [gdscript] var some_string = "One,Two,Three,Four" var some_array = some_string.rsplit(",", true, 1) print(some_array.size()) # Prints 2 print(some_array[0]) # Prints "Four" print(some_array[1]) # Prints "Three,Two,One" [/gdscript] [csharp] // There is no Rsplit. [/csharp] [/codeblocks]

method.name: rstrip
method.description: Returns a copy of the string with characters removed from the right. The [code]chars[/code] argument is a string specifying the set of characters to be removed. [b]Note:[/b] The [code]chars[/code] is not a suffix. See [method trim_suffix] method that will remove a single suffix string rather than a set of characters.

method.name: sha1_buffer
method.description: Returns the SHA-1 hash of the string as an array of bytes.

method.name: sha1_text
method.description: Returns the SHA-1 hash of the string as a string.

method.name: sha256_buffer
method.description: Returns the SHA-256 hash of the string as an array of bytes.

method.name: sha256_text
method.description: Returns the SHA-256 hash of the string as a string.

method.name: similarity
method.description: Returns the similarity index of the text compared to this string. 1 means totally similar and 0 means totally dissimilar.

method.name: simplify_path
method.description: Returns a simplified canonical path.

method.name: split
method.description: Splits the string by a [code]delimiter[/code] string and returns an array of the substrings. The [code]delimiter[/code] can be of any length. If [code]maxsplit[/code] is specified, it defines the number of splits to do from the left up to [code]maxsplit[/code]. The default value of [code]0[/code] means that all items are split. If you need only one element from the array at a specific index, [method get_slice] is a more performant option. Example: [codeblocks] [gdscript] var some_string = "One,Two,Three,Four" var some_array = some_string.split(",", true, 1) print(some_array.size()) # Prints 2 print(some_array[0]) # Prints "Four" print(some_array[1]) # Prints "Three,Two,One" [/gdscript] [csharp] var someString = "One,Two,Three,Four"; var someArray = someString.Split(",", true); // This is as close as it gets to Godots API. GD.Print(someArray[0]); // Prints "Four" GD.Print(someArray[1]); // Prints "Three,Two,One" [/csharp] [/codeblocks] If you need to split strings with more complex rules, use the [RegEx] class instead.

method.name: split_floats
method.description: Splits the string in floats by using a delimiter string and returns an array of the substrings. For example, [code]"1,2.5,3"[/code] will return [code][1,2.5,3][/code] if split by [code]","[/code].

method.name: strip_edges
method.description: Returns a copy of the string stripped of any non-printable character (including tabulations, spaces and line breaks) at the beginning and the end. The optional arguments are used to toggle stripping on the left and right edges respectively.

method.name: strip_escapes
method.description: Returns a copy of the string stripped of any escape character. These include all non-printable control characters of the first page of the ASCII table (< 32), such as tabulation ([code]\t[/code] in C) and newline ([code]\n[/code] and [code]\r[/code]) characters, but not spaces.

method.name: substr
method.description: Returns part of the string from the position [code]from[/code] with length [code]len[/code]. Argument [code]len[/code] is optional and using [code]-1[/code] will return remaining characters from given position.

method.name: to_ascii_buffer
method.description: Converts the String (which is a character array) to ASCII/Latin-1 encoded [PackedByteArray] (which is an array of bytes). The conversion is faster compared to [method to_utf8_buffer], as this method assumes that all the characters in the String are ASCII/Latin-1 characters, unsupported characters are replaced with spaces.

method.name: to_float
method.description: Converts a string containing a decimal number into a [code]float[/code].

method.name: to_int
method.description: Converts a string containing an integer number into an [code]int[/code].

method.name: to_lower
method.description: Returns the string converted to lowercase.

method.name: to_upper
method.description: Returns the string converted to uppercase.

method.name: to_utf16_buffer
method.description: Converts the String (which is an array of characters) to UTF-16 encoded [PackedByteArray] (which is an array of bytes).

method.name: to_utf32_buffer
method.description: Converts the String (which is an array of characters) to UTF-32 encoded [PackedByteArray] (which is an array of bytes).

method.name: to_utf8_buffer
method.description: Converts the String (which is an array of characters) to UTF-8 encode [PackedByteArray] (which is an array of bytes). The conversion is a bit slower than [method to_ascii_buffer], but supports all UTF-8 characters. Therefore, you should prefer this function over [method to_ascii_buffer].

method.name: trim_prefix
method.description: Removes a given string from the start if it starts with it or leaves the string unchanged.

method.name: trim_suffix
method.description: Removes a given string from the end if it ends with it or leaves the string unchanged.

method.name: unicode_at
method.description: Returns the character code at position [code]at[/code].

method.name: uri_decode
method.description: Decodes a string in URL encoded format. This is meant to decode parameters in a URL when receiving an HTTP request. [codeblocks] [gdscript] print("https://example.org/?escaped=" + "Godot%20Engine%3A%27docs%27".uri_decode()) [/gdscript] [csharp] GD.Print("https://example.org/?escaped=" + "Godot%20Engine%3a%27Docs%27".URIDecode()); [/csharp] [/codeblocks]

method.name: uri_encode
method.description: Encodes a string to URL friendly format. This is meant to encode parameters in a URL when sending an HTTP request. [codeblocks] [gdscript] print("https://example.org/?escaped=" + "Godot Engine:'docs'".uri_encode()) [/gdscript] [csharp] GD.Print("https://example.org/?escaped=" + "Godot Engine:'docs'".URIEncode()); [/csharp] [/codeblocks]

method.name: validate_node_name
method.description: Removes any characters from the string that are prohibited in [Node] names ([code].[/code] [code]:[/code] [code]@[/code] [code]/[/code] [code]"[/code]).

method.name: xml_escape
method.description: Returns a copy of the string with special characters escaped using the XML standard. If [code]escape_quotes[/code] is [code]true[/code], the single quote ([code]'[/code]) and double quote ([code]"[/code]) characters are also escaped.

method.name: xml_unescape
method.description: Returns a copy of the string with escaped characters replaced by their meanings according to the XML standard.
